intro: Stachys chamissonis, commonly known as creeping deadnettle, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its square stems and pairs of opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it an important plant in ecological gardens.
